title.narrative: 6.01 HEALTH COVID-19 RESPONSE

description.narrative: 106/001 Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to Health services and critical supplies for women and children for strengthening Infection Prevention and Control and for suppressing the COVID-19 transmission at community level, which contributes to Child Health, Child Health (Covid), Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Maternal And Newborn Health (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. By 2022, children and women have equitable access to knowledge and services related to COVID-19 prevention and treatment in the areas of health, nutrition, education, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and child protection in the most deprived areas, including Rohingya refugee camps.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 106/001 Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to Health services and critical supplies forwomen and children for strengthening Infection Prevention and Control and for suppressing the COVID-19 transmission at communitylevel

description.narrative: During the 3rd;wave of COVID-19, UNICEF functionalized 30 health facilities with Liquid Medical Oxygen;and served;64,309;patients;during the last;six months.;With UNICEF support, 340 healthcare workers (211 female) in Rohingya refugee camps in Cox’s Bazar enhanced their Infection Prevention and Control knowledge.;179 health workers supported COVID-19 Community Based Surveillance across 10 camps and;identified 4,095 COVID-19 suspected cases. UNICEF supported;primary health care;in camps;and;referred 266 suspected COVID-19 cases (144 female);to;Severe Acute Respiratory Infection Isolation and Treatment Center;(SARI-ITC);for testing, isolation, and treatment.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
